title: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:
As some of the elder PCKF residents are aware, AR made a page a while back (a long while back) about the internal organs of the BWBMR. It still resides on Geocities' server, but has not been updated for a considerable period of time (since before Isis). It can currently be found [url=http://www.geocities.com/SiliconValley/Orchard/6221/bwbrtm.htm]here[/url]. However, since this is one of the more creative early artifacts of Keen fandom, I believe it should have a secure home. How long will geocities hold onto an inactive site?[img]http://www.angelfire.lycos.com/mech/roboblue/Robo_Blue.gif[/img] [url=http://members.cox.net/aborlan/Keenbound/kbframeset.htm]Official Keenbound Site[/url]
[url=http://chat.cjb.net/dosgamers/]Visit #dosgamers on irc.mircx.com![/url]

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:
Flaose left, Thea was already gone, and chogall was going to be absent for six months, and eK almost never comes anyways, so they needed a new admin, and picked me.[hr]
Never argue with an idiot. He brings you down to his level, then beats you on experience -- Mark Twain
[url=http://spatang.com] spatang.com[/url]

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:
Wow...you're lucky.*RoBoReD*

Over and out.

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content: Ah, that's pretty good site. Anyways - I've been thinking to archive some sites too, I could do this one too. Spare copy often isn't harmful. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] "For years they studied, collected, catalogued. When they had learned all that they could, they began to modify." 3001: The final Odyssey

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content: great, i e-mailed joesph a while back about hosting them on keen online when i noticed that many of them were gone, but he had e-mail problems so i don't think he got it.[img]http://commanderkeen.soupinajamjar.com/graphics/website/icon02.gif[/img] Keen says: [url=http://commanderkeen.soupinajamjar.com]Visit keen online for all you keen needs.[/url]

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:
it's nice to see some of the old ology pages, but I'm sad not to be able to see the original that inspired them all.[img]http://www.angelfire.lycos.com/mech/roboblue/Robo_Blue.gif[/img] [url=http://members.cox.net/aborlan/Keenbound/kbframeset.htm]Official Keenbound Site[/url]

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:
They only remenants of the original is this:
[img]http://spatang.com/mirrors/bloogology314.gif[/img]

Unfortunately, all my attempts to recover the site including looking at archives have led me to pr0n sites. Don't go to the address the site is "supposedly" at.[hr]

content:

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:

No sign of bloogology, though.[img]http://www.angelfire.lycos.com/mech/roboblue/Robo_Blue.gif[/img] [url=http://members.cox.net/aborlan/Keenbound/kbframeset.htm]Official Keenbound Site[/url]

title: Re: Raiders of the Lost BWBMR Technical Manual
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]How long will geocities hold onto an inactive site?[hr][/quote]

I don't think geocities will ever shut down an inactive site because you'll never know when it will come in handy.
I guess you can delete your own site on geocities if you really wanted to.

Oh, I was surprised that Xtra become an admin so soon. What with most of the admins are leaving, Xtra's a good choice. It's also hard to find a trustworthy member in the PCKF. You never know when somebody might decide to rebel. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img]

KeenRush is a good choice for admin too, but he might take that opportunity to... spam the boards [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] you know what i'm talking about! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Family, Religion, Friendship. These are the three demons you must slay if you wish to succeed in business! - Charles Montgomery Burns
